intro: Stemonurus dichrocarpus, commonly known as the two-colored stemonurus, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in high-altitude grasslands. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
